alert.note: Alert for Providence (Rhode Island) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:18PM EST until December 20 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Rhode Island...Massachusetts... Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Worcester and Providence Counties. For the Blackstone River...including Woonsocket...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blackstone River at Woonsocket. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Flooding is likely in lower lying sections of Woonsocket and Cumberland. Deep floodwaters are expected in the lower level of the River Island Condominiums in Woonsocket. Several buisnesses along the river will have several feet of water into their parking areas. Action will be needed to clear vehicles from these areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Monday was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 14.4 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 03/19/1936. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1000 AM EST.
